summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, and the Bureau of Prisons (BOP). Sternheim complains that legal mail she deposited for Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) on October 2, 2021, has not been delivered, threatening to file an order to show cause with the court. The correspondence highlights pre-trial access issues for Maxwell ahead of her November 29, 2021 trial.

events.title: Legal Mail Deposit at MDC
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim personally deposits legal mail for Ghislaine Maxwell in the East Building legal mailbox at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Threat to File Order to Show Cause
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim sends an email to the BOP threatening to file an order to show cause with the Court if Maxwell does not receive her delayed legal mail by 9:30 AM.

events.title: Scheduled Start of Maxwell's Trial
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial is scheduled to begin on this date, a fact cited by her attorney to emphasize the urgency of resolving the mail delay.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, accused the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) of delaying the delivery of legal mail deposited on October 2, 2021.
Sternheim threatened to file an order to show cause with the Court if the mail was not delivered by 9:30 AM on October 7, 2021.
The correspondence states that Maxwell's trial was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, and that mail delays were interfering with her trial preparation.
Sternheim noted that legal mail she deposited for another client in the MDC's west building on the same day had been delivered, but Maxwell's had not.
